page.title: 02ECOLOGY..WILDLIFE HABITATS
page.content: Although much of the area is rich farmland nonetheless our survey has shown that there is a rich diversity of wildlife habitats still in existence.There are many kilometres of hedgerow along road sides and field boundaries.Wide grass verges exist along all of the winding country roads which criss-cross through our area.Several fields near Cupar have been permanent pasture for as long as anyone can remember and as such they provide a natural habitat for several creatures.A few derelict quarries on the Mount Hill are now filled with water and these pools attract frogs,newts and water insects. Contrasting with this on the upper slopes of Mount Hill there are large areas of rough grazing with broken patches of woodland and bracken;Ideal cover for deer,rabbits and pheasants.
